business.headline: Thinking of buying digital gold? Sebi warns it's not a regulated productSebi further clarified that investor protection mechanisms applicable to regulated securities will not extend to such unregulated digital gold schemes.

Musk to pocket $1,000,000,000,000. What will he do with all the money?Elon Musk has been one of the world's richest people for several years now. And a $1 trillion pay package, which comes with conditions, will only make him richer. It has led social media to wonder how Musk, who is known not to live an extravagant life, will spend his money.

Wills aren't just for the old. Here's why you should have one tooFor most Indians, a will is something you think about when your hair turns grey, or you are on their deathbeds, but making a will early can be one of the most responsible things you do for your future.

Gold vs real estate: Where should you invest?Safe glitter or solid bricks? Investors have always loved gold and property, but choosing between the two can be tricky. With inflation, demand, and prices on the rise, it's time to ask—where you should put your money.

Adani Power bags Bhagalpur's 2,400 MW project tenderFour qualified bidders participated in the tender, with Adani Power quoting the lowest electricity tariff of Rs 6.075 per kWh (or per unit), sources with direct knowledge of the bidding process said.

Gold trades at around Rs 1.21 lakh per 10 grams: Should you buy or wait?Gold's shine shows no sign of fading as global uncertainty, a weak dollar, and festive demand keep prices high. But should investors buy now or wait for the next dip?
Sensex, Nifty end week in red amid weak global cues and FII sellingThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 94.73 points to end at 83,216.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 17.40 points to close at 25,492.30.

BSE share price jumps nearly 9% despite market slump. Here's what drove the rallyAt the end of the trading session on November 7, BSE shares closed 8.61% higher at Rs 2,666.90 apiece on the NSE, bucking the overall market trend.

Lenskart IPO listing next week: Will it deliver profits or disappoint?Lenskart IPO received a strong response from investors, and was subscribed 28.27 times overall, indicating robust demand across categories.

Not 1, 3, or Rs 5 crore. Here's how much Shiv Nadar donated per day last yearShiv Nadar and his family donated a total of Rs 2,708 crore in the last year, which comes to nearly Rs 7.4 crore per day. This is the fourth time in five years that Nadar has topped the list.

Why urban millennials are renting lifestyle products instead of buying themUrban millennials are rewriting the rules of ownership. Instead of buying lifestyle products, from furniture to gadgets, they're choosing to rent. The reason? Flexibility, affordability, and freedom from long-term commitments.

Planning voluntary retirement under UPS? All you need to knowThe guidelines aim to offer clarity and smoother planning for retirement decisions, ensuring eligible employees understand their rights, timelines, and benefits under UPS.

Groww IPO closes today. Here's what the latest GMP signalsWith the IPO closing today, attention now shifts to final subscription numbers and post-allotment reactions. Analysts expect a modestly positive debut given the strong retail response and steady grey market sentiment.

Financial watchdog to seek RBI's help in IndusInd Bank forex hedging probeAs of now, EOW officials have recorded statements of around 12 people from IndusInd Bank, which includes the former top management and other employees in connection with the ongoing investigations into the accounting lapse at the bank of Rs 2000 crore.

Why a magical 12% SIP may not give you solid returns? Expert breaks it downEither compare everything in nominal terms, without adjusting for inflation, or adjust every single figure — contributions, taxes, fees, and final value — for inflation, says expert.

Gold and silver are rising again. What's driving the fresh rally?On Friday morning, gold futures on the MCX were trading around Rs 1,21 lakh per 10 grams, while silver was trading over Rs 1,48 lakh per kg. Both metals have rebounded from their one-week lows, aided by a weaker US dollar and fresh geopolitical tensions.

Elon Musk's $1 trillion payday sounds huge. But can he actually earn it?To actually collect on this historic paycheque, Musk must achieve what Tesla's board calls "Mars-shot milestones", a suite of operational and financial targets.

Sensex tumbles 500 points: Why stock market is down todayThe broad-based weakness comes as investors continue to digest a mix of global uncertainties, ranging from geopolitical tensions to expectations of prolonged high interest rates in the US.

Lenskart IPO allotment out: Check latest GMP, listing date and moreLenskart's IPO allotment is done, but all eyes are now on its stock market debut. With strong demand and a steady GMP, will India's eyewear leader deliver clear gains?

Bharti Airtel shares tumble 4% in early trade. What's behind the fall?At 9:29 am, Bharti Airtel shares were down 3.66% at Rs 2,018 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with heavy volumes recorded in the opening minutes of trade. The decline came even as broader market sentiment remained weak.

entertainment.headline: Sobhita Dhulipala's Telugu wins over husband Naga Chaitanya Naga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala's bond draws attention as they share insights on language, identity, and comfort ahead of their December anniversary.

Mahesh Babu teases Globetrotter glimpse event, to stream on JioHotstar. Details Mahesh Babu has announced the first event for his upcoming SS Rajamouli film 'Globetrotter', set for November 15 in Hyderabad. The event will be livestreamed on JioHotstar.

Ishaan Khatter, Vishal Jethwa attend Homebound screening with Martin Scorsese The 'Homebound' team marked a special evening in New York, joining executive producer Martin Scorsese for a screening. Director Neeraj Ghaywan and lead actors Ishaan Khatter and Vishal Jethwa were in attendance.

Vijay Varma opens up on battling depression, and how Ira Khan helped him heal Actor Vijay Varma has spoken out about his long-standing emotional struggles, shaped by a fraught relationship with his father and a difficult decade before his breakthrough in 'Gully Boy'. He credited Ira Khan for guiding him towards therapy during a deep depressive episode in the lockdown.

Deepika Padukone recalls facing colourism, stereotypes in Hollywood During a recent conversation, Deepika Padukone spoke about her experiences in Hollywood. She highlighted the persistent stereotypes about India in the West and discussed the challenges she faced, including being offered cliched roles and confronting colourism.

Thalapathy Kacheri from Vijay's Jana Nayagan is Anirudh's fan anthem for actor The first single 'Thalapathy Kacheri' from Vijay's upcoming film 'Jana Nayagan' has been released, featuring a high-energy fan anthem by Anirudh. The film, marking Vijay's last performance as an actor, is scheduled to hit theatres on January 9, 2026.

Mahhi Vij back home after hospitalisation, shares pic with family Actor Mahhi Vij has been discharged from the hospital after being admitted due to a high fever. She shared a health update on Instagram on Saturday.

Priyanka Chopra's Hindi twist to Last Christmas: Video and reactions here Priyanka Chopra Jonas has made a musical comeback with a Hindi version of George Michael's 'Last Christmas' for the festive film 'Christmas Karma', sparking mixed reactions online. While some fans appreciate her bold and nostalgic effort, others criticise the bilingual lyrics and translation.

Sham Kaushal overjoyed as Vicky-Katrina welcome baby boy: God has been kind Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif joyfully welcomed their baby boy, bringing immense happiness to their family and fans alike. Sham Kaushal, Vicky's father, shared a heartwarming reaction on becoming a grandfather.

Did Rashmika Mandanna just confirm she'd marry Vijay Deverakonda? Watch the video Rashmika Mandanna opened up about her idea of love and the kind of partner she wants, saying she values loyalty and someone who would "fight a war" with her. Her comments come amid strong rumours that she and Vijay Deverakonda are engaged and planning a February 2026 wedding.

Dhurandhar: Ranveer Singh introduces Arjun Rampal as Angel of Death. First look Arjun Rampal's fierce first look from 'Dhurandhar' has fans buzzing after Ranveer Singh called him an "Angel of Death." The Aditya Dhar directorial, also starring Sanjay Dutt and Akshaye Khanna, releases on December 5, 2025.

Four More Shots Please actors Kirti Kulhari, Rajeev Siddhartha dating: Sources  'Four More Shots Please!' co-stars Kirti Kulhari and Rajeev Siddhartha are reportedly dating after growing close while working together on the show. Though the actors haven't made their relationship official, their affectionate social media posts and pictures have sparked buzz among fans.

Gouri Kishan issues statement after body-shaming incident. Read it here Actor Gouri Kishan stood up against a journalist who made a comment about her weight during a press meet for her film 'Others'. After the video went viral, she shared a statement saying such questions are wrong and urged people to treat everyone with more respect and sensitivity.

Anushka Sharma's Chakda Xpress release in talks as makers appeal to Netflix: Report After years of delay, the makers of Anushka Sharma's 'Chakda Xpress' have urged Netflix to release the long-awaited Jhulan Goswami biopic, following the Indian women's cricket team's recent historic win. The film, completed in 2022, had reportedly been stuck due to creative disagreements and budget concerns.

Jeremy Renner accused of misconduct by filmmaker Yi Zhou: He threatened to call ICE Chinese filmmaker Yi Zhou has accused Hollywood star Jeremy Renner of sending her unsolicited explicit images and threatening to call US immigration authorities on her after she confronted him about his behaviour.

Baahubali series to Mirzapur movie: The great screen swap has arrived Indian entertainment is witnessing a dynamic shift as films turn into series and web shows make their way to the big screen. Audiences today crave stories that go beyond a single format, seeking deeper, more immersive experiences across every platform.

A decade later, Baahubali the Epic reveals its deepest truths As part of our Retro Review series, we revisit 'Baahubali', the grand spectacle that redefined Indian cinema, to uncover its buried moral questions and rediscover why its tragedy still resonates.

Jatadhara box office Day 1: Sonakshi Sinha, Sudheer Babu film opens with Rs 20 lakh Sonakshi Sinha and Sudheer Babu's supernatural thriller 'Jatadhara' opened to positive reviews but a weak box office start, earning around Rs 20 lakh on Day 1.

general news.headline: Months before Delhi airport glitch, Air Traffic Controllers flagged technical gapsIn July, the Air Traffic Controllers' Guild had urged that air navigation systems be periodically reviewed and upgraded to global standard. Months later, Delhi airport witnessed a major system crash.

Afghan-Pak peace talks collapse after Islamabad's 'beyond capacity' demandPeace talks between Afghanistan and Pakistan collapsed after Islamabad demanded Kabul take responsibility for Pakistan's internal security, a condition the Taliban called "beyond capacity."

Rahul Gandhi's '501 voters' example in Haryana turns out to be data entry mix-upRahul Gandhi had alleged that 501 voters were registered under a single address in Haryana's Hodal town. An on-ground visit to the area revealed a clerical mix-up.

Delhi-NCR gasps as air quality teeters on severe threshold amid dense smogDelhi's air quality stayed in the 'very poor' range on Sunday, with AQI hitting 391 and several areas crossing 400, as smog lingered and temperatures dipped.

How Mamdani could move from one-bedroom rented home to NYC's mayoral mansionZohran Mamdani, an Indian-American Democratic socialist, recently made history as New York City's first Indian-American, Muslim mayor, bringing a grassroots voice from Astoria's one-bedroom apartments to City Hall's grand stage.

UK spies handed over intel to Canada on 'India link' in Nijjar killing: ReportA Bloomberg documentary claims UK spy intercepts helped Canada link India to Hardeep Singh Nijjar's 2023 killing, sparking a major diplomatic row that India dismissed as politically motivated.

Kerala CM alleges students made to sing RSS song by Railways, school deniesPinarayi Vijayan criticised Southern Railway after students were allegedly made to sing the RSS Gana Geet at the Ernakulam–Bengaluru Vande Bharat launch. However, the school wrote to PM Modi clarifying that the Malayalam song was patriotic and did not contain any words against secularism or national unity.

Chandrayaan-2 sends radar images of water ice, and soil on the MoonOver the past five years, nearly 1,400 radar datasets have been collected and processed to generate detailed polarimetric mosaics covering latitudes from 80 to 90 degrees in both hemispheres.

With Islamists at the helm, can Bangladesh deliver free, fair elections?Once hailed as a non-violent, student-led uprising for justice and fair elections, the quota reform movement now stands exposed as an armed conspiracy of Jamaat-e-Islami. The Islamists are trying for a new state structure, resembling the era of Pakistan rule. The current regime isn't neutral and does not intend to hold free and fair elections.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

Man opens fire at immigration officers in Chicago amid raid, says US governmentA man allegedly opened fire on US Border Patrol agents during an immigration raid in Chicago, though police said no one was injured. The suspect, driving a black Jeep, remains at large as tensions rise over federal immigration operations.

James Watson dies at 97: Man who revealed DNA double helix leaves troubled legacyJames D Watson, the Nobel-winning co-discoverer of DNA's double helix, has died at 97. His legacy blends scientific triumph with deep controversy, reshaping biology while igniting enduring debate. Here's a look at his life and work.

VVPAT slips found dumped in Samastipur, officials say they're from mock pollsA video showed hundreds of VVPAT slips thrown on the side of the road in Bihar's Samastipur just two days after polling in the district.

Canada deports 3 in gang extortion probe after attacks on Indian businesses, homesCanada has deported three foreign nationals linked to gang-led extortion rackets after a surge in attacks targeting Indian-owned businesses and homes. Authorities have also identified 78 others under investigation.

After India war lessons, Pak plans a unified command. More power for Munir?Months after its brief but bruising military confrontation with India, Pakistan is moving to constitutionally overhaul its military command structure. It is going to create a powerful new post for a unified command of its army, navy, and air force. The move will see army chief Asim Munir gain with the civilian government ceding power.

Elena Rybakina stuns Aryna Sabalenka to claim maiden WTA Finals title Elena Rybakina defeated world No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka 6‑3, 7‑6 (0) to claim her maiden WTA Finals title in Riyadh, remaining undefeated throughout the tournament. Her victory marked a historic milestone as the first Kazakhstani to win the WTA Finals.

In-form Dhruv Jurel to play as a batter, Nitish Reddy likely to be dropped: Report Rishabh Pant will return as India's first-choice wicketkeeper, but Dhruv Jurel's strong red-ball form means he is set to play as a specialist batter against South Africa. Spurs looked set to take the win, but United's late pressure paid off in a tense Premier League encounter.

Quinton de Kock attains new high, leaves Graeme Smith behind in major listQuinton de Kock scripted a major milestone in the decisive third ODI against Pakistan, crossing the 7,000-run mark and moving past Graeme Smith on South Africa's list of all-time ODI run scorers. He became the fifth South African to score 7000 runs in ODIs with his third successive fifty-plus score.

Carlos Alcaraz can snatch year-end No.1 ranking from Jannik Sinner. Here's howCarlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner are locked in a thrilling battle for the year-end World No. 1 spot at the 2025 ATP Finals in Turin. No longer ice and fire, it's fire and fire: Abhishek on partnership with GillAustralia vs India, 5th T20I: After India sealed the series, opener Abhishek Sharma and captain Suryakumar Yadav praised the opening partnership and highlighted Shubman Gill's ability to keep up with the tempo.

Asia Cup Trophy War: ICC Steps In, BCCI And PCB Hold Talks In Dubai To End Asia Cup Trophy StandoffThis special report focuses on the ongoing dispute between the BCCI and the PCB over the 2025 Asia Cup trophy, following a crucial meeting in Dubai between BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia and PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi. Following the discussion, Saikia stated, 'Both sides cordially participated in the meeting which took place on the sidelines of the ICC board meet'. India won the T20 tournament on September 28 but the team refused to accept the trophy from Naqvi, who is also the Asian Cricket Council President and Pakistan's Interior Minister. The trophy has since remained at the ACC headquarters in Dubai. The ICC has now facilitated talks and formed a committee to help find an amicable resolution to the stalemate between the two powerful cricket boards.

India Conquer Australia 2-1, Clinch T20I Series Down UnderThis special report focuses on the Indian cricket team's triumphant T20I series victory in Australia, sealed 2-1 after the final match in Brisbane was abandoned due to weather. The series highlighted the impressive form of captain Suryakumar Yadav, opener Shubman Gill, and the standout performer, Abhishek Sharma, who was named Player of the Series. According to the expert analysis, 'India will have to take this particular series with a pinch of salt because be mindful of the fact Australia weren't playing their full-fledged T20I team.' This victory continues a remarkable unbeaten T20I series streak for India under Yadav's captaincy. The report also touches upon Shubman Gill's recent appointment as Test captain and the scheduling of the upcoming Ashes series, which sees some of Australia's key players focusing on the Test format.

IPL 2026 retention list to be unveiled on November 15, confirm broadcastersIPL 2026: All 10 franchises will announce their lists of retained and released players on 15 November, a month before what is expected to be a mini-auction for the upcoming Indian Premier League season.

See you soon: Jemimah Rodrigues heads to Australia for WBBL after World Cup winJemimah Rodrigues is set to rejoin Brisbane Heat for the upcoming WBBL season, just days after helping India win the ICC Women's World Cup. The 24-year-old batter, who scored a 127 in the semifinal against Australia, will be in action when the Heat face Melbourne Renegades on November 9.
